thing-type.label: ArgoClima A/C - Local
thing-type.description:
ArgoClima Ulisse Eco 13-compatible Air Conditioner (local LAN connection)
Independent mode - does not require Internet connectivity (see connectionMode setting for more options).

parameter-group.name: serverStub
parameter-group.label: Argo Server Stub
parameter-group.description: Configuration of openHAB acting as Argo API server (requires proxying device-side traffic to this OH instance). These settings are effective only for REMOTE_API_STUB | REMOTE_API_PROXY connection modes.

parameter.name: hostname
parameter.label: Hostname
parameter.description:
Hostname or IP address of the HVAC device.
If useLocalConnection setting is enabled, this address will be used for (command push + status polling) communication with the device.

parameter.name: hvacListenPort
parameter.label: Device API Listen Port
parameter.description:
Port at which the local device listens on.
This setting is effective only if Use Local Connection is true. The default value 1001 is hard-coded in Argo Firmware. You would only need to override it if the device is behind NAT, and you have configured a custom port forwarding rule using port other than 1001

parameter.name: localDeviceIP
parameter.label: Local IP Address
parameter.description:
Local IP address of the device in its local subnet (may be different from hostname, if behind NAT).
Optional, value is used for detecting device-side updates in one of the REMOTE modes.

parameter.name: deviceCpuId
parameter.label: CPU ID
parameter.description: CPU ID of the device. Optional, value is used for detecting device update in proxy mode.

parameter.name: connectionMode
parameter.label: Connection Mode
parameter.description:
Type of connection to use.
- LOCAL_CONNECTION - Directly communicates with the AC device over LAN (default mode).
- REMOTE_API_STUB - openHAB simulates vendor's remote server (most functionality implemented, w/o FW update support). Requires traffic from the AC re-routed to this OH instance (network-level configuration, see README). Allows full-local control (w/o Internet access to the device). Can also control units which are not directly reachable over LAN, e.g. behind NAT (set Local IP address).
- REMOTE_API_PROXY - openHAB behaves as a proxy to the remote Manufacturer's server (injects OH-side commands). Allows to still use the Vendor's application. WARNING: This mode (similarly to using vanilla Argo WebApp) may be considered insecure (plain HTTP communications, passwords transmitted in the clear, unsigned FW updates...).

options.option: LOCAL_CONNECTION - Local only (no remote server stub). (**Default**)
REMOTE_API_STUB - openHAB as ArgoClima server stub. [Advanced] (**Recommended**)
REMOTE_API_PROXY - openHAB as ArgoClima server w/ pass-through to OEM app. [Advanced]

parameter.name: useLocalConnection
parameter.label: Use Local Connection
parameter.description:
If enabled, will directly communicate with the device to send commands and poll for its status.
Must be enabled for LOCAL_CONNECTION mode. If disabled (in any of the REMOTE_* connection modes), no push communication will be initiated from OH-side, and commands will be sent on next device-side poll cycle (possible delay)

parameter.name: refreshInterval
parameter.label: Refresh Interval
parameter.description:
Interval the device is polled in seconds. This setting is only effective if Use Local Connection is ON.
Set to 0 to disable polling (requires any of REMOTE_* connection modes)

parameter.name: stubServerPort
parameter.label: Stub Server Listen Port
parameter.description:
Port at which the Stub server will listen on.
This setting is effective only for REMOTE_* connection modes

parameter.name: stubServerListenAddresses
parameter.label: Stub Server Listen Adresses
parameter.description:
List of interfaces the stub server will listen on
This setting is effective only for REMOTE_API_STUB | REMOTE_API_PROXY connection modes

parameter.name: oemServerAddress
parameter.label: Argo Remote Server Address
parameter.description:
The OEM server's port, used to pass through the communications to.
This setting is effective only for REMOTE_API_PROXY connection mode

parameter.name: oemServerPort
parameter.label: Argo Remote Server Port
parameter.description:
The OEM server's port, used to pass through the communications to
This setting is effective only for REMOTE_API_PROXY connection mode

parameter.name: includeDeviceSidePasswordsInProperties
parameter.label: Include Device-Side Passwords
parameter.description:
Whether to include the intercepted passwords to the HVAC as well as the Wi-Fi (sent by the device to Argo servers) as Thing propertis.
(applicable only to REMOTE_* connection modes)
IMPORTANT: Regardless of this setting, the values ARE sent in the clear (and w/o HTTPS) by the device to the vendor servers. To prevent them from leaking, you may want to create a firewall rule redirecting HVAC traffic to openHAB (instead of talking to Argo servers), and use REMOTE_API_STUB mode of this binding.

options.option: NEVER - The passwords are not exposed as Thing properties. (**Default**)
MASKED - Intercepted Wi-Fi and HVAC passwords are displayed as properties, but masked with ***.
CLEARTEXT - Intercepted Wi-Fi and HVAC passwords are displayed as Thing properties, in cleartext.

parameter.name: matchAnyIncomingDeviceIp
parameter.label: Match ANY Incoming Device IP
parameter.description:
If enabled, will not attempt to match the incoming Argo requests by IP (neither 'Local IP address (behind NAT)' nor 'Hostname'), and instead accept ANY device-side Argo protocol request as matching THIS Thing.
Applicable only to REMOTE_* modes. (not recommended, use only for single Argo HVAC in the network, when its local IP is not known)

thing-type.label: ArgoClima A/C - Remote
thing-type.description:
ArgoClima Ulisse Eco 13-compatible Air Conditioner (remote connection via Argo servers)
Requires Internet connectivity for both openHAB and the HVAC device separately.

parameter.name: refreshInterval
parameter.label: Refresh Interval
parameter.description: Interval the vendor device API is polled in (in seconds).

parameter.name: oemServerAddress
parameter.label: Argo Remote Server Address
parameter.description:
The OEM server's hostname, used for communications.
This is the same host as for the Web Application (address provided in device's user manual). Example: uisetup.ddns.net

channel-group-type.label: Unsupported Modes
channel-group-type.description: These channels are available on the original Argo remote (and app), but the Ulisse DCI device does not support it.
